Name: Lodash
Description: ... makes JavaScript easier by taking the hassle out of working with arrays, numbers, objects, strings, etc.
RandomFact: 2015 was big year! ... became the most depended on npm package, passed 1 billion downloads, & its v3 release saw massive adoption!

Name: Cloudinary
Description: Effortlessly optimize, transform, upload and manage your cloud's assets.
RandomFact: Image and Video API for Powerful Visual Experiences - Store, transform, optimize, and deliver all your media assets with easy-to-use APIs, widgets, or user interface.

Name: Axios
Description: Promise based HTTP client for the browser and node.js
RandomFact: Matt Zabriskie is the founder of the npm package, started in the summer of 2014.

Name: chalk
Description: Terminal string styling done right

Name: mustache.js
Description: Logic-less {{...}} templates with JavaScript.  ... is a zero-dependency implementation of the ... template system in JavaScript.
RandomFact: You can use ... to render mustache templates anywhere you can use JavaScript. This includes web browsers, server-side environments such as Node.js, and CouchDB views.

Name: minimist
Description: This module is the guts of optimist's argument parser without all the fanciful decoration.
CodeExample: ```$ node example/parse.js -a beep -b boop { _: [], a: 'beep', b: 'boop' }```

Name: Commander.js
Description: The complete solution for node.js command-line interfaces.
RandomFact: There is an old-school DOS | OS/2 | Windows file manager with a similar name.

Name: react
Description: A declarative, efficient, and flexible JavaScript library for building user interfaces.

Name: vue
Description: ... is a progressive, incrementally-adoptable JavaScript framework for building UI on the web.

Name: js-tokens
Description: The tiny, regex powered, lenient, almost spec-compliant JavaScript tokenizer that never fails.
CodeExample:
```// Get all tokens as an array:
const tokens = Array.from(*redacted*("hello, !world"));```

Name: express
Description: Fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js.
RandomFact: "Most of nike.com's ecommerce experience is on top of <...>... in fact they've left the x-powered-by headers intact." -- Reddit

Name: underscore
Description: ... is a utility-belt library for JavaScript that provides support for the usual functional suspects (each, map, reduce, filter...) without extending any core JavaScript objects.

Name: async
Description: Async is a utility module which provides straight-forward, powerful functions for working with asynchronous JavaScript.

Name: moment
Description: A JavaScript date library for parsing, validating, manipulating, and formatting dates.

Name: glob
Description: Match files using the patterns the shell uses, like stars and stuff.

Name: readable-stream
Description: Some Node.js functionality for userland

Name: jQuery
Description: ... is a fast, small, and feature-rich JavaScript library.
RandomFact: ... was found on more than 80 million websites in 2022.

Name: mkdirp
Description: A POSIX feature within Node.js

Name: colors.js
Description: get colors in your node.js console
CodeExample:
```
console.log('hello'.green); // outputs green text
console.log('i like cake and pies'.underline.red); // outputs red underlined text
console.log('inverse the color'.inverse); // inverses the color
console.log('OMG Rainbows!'.rainbow); // rainbow
console.log('Run the trap'.trap); // Drops the bass```

Name: semver
Description: The semantic versioner for npm

Name: fs-extra
Description: ... adds file system methods that aren't included in the native fs module and adds promise support to the fs methods. It also uses graceful-fs to prevent EMFILE errors. It should be a drop in replacement for fs.
RandomFact: Why? I got tired of including mkdirp, rimraf, and ncp in most of my projects.

Name: escape-string-regexp
Description: Escape RegExp special characters

Name: create-t3-app
Description: Interactive CLI to start a full-stack, typesafe Next.js app.

Name: uuid
Description: For the creation of RFC4122 ....s

Name: webpack
Description: ... is a module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging just about any resource or asset.

Name: rimraf
Description: The UNIX command ... for node.

Name: Next.js
Description: The React Framework, that has uses cases like: Server-side Rendering or Static Generation, and updating or creating content at runtime with Incremental Static Regeneration.

Name: Angular
Description: ... is a development platform for building mobile and desktop web applications using Typescript/JavaScript and other languages.

Name: Redux
Description: ... is a predictable state container for JavaScript apps.

Name: socket.io
Description: ... enables real-time bidirectional event-based communication.

Name: Jest
Description: Delightful JavaScript Testing.
